channel.title: Simplicity
channel.description:
[QUOTE][CENTER][IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/5obgi.gif[/img]
[U][B][size=10pt]W[/size][/B][/U]elcome to my project thread for my Late 2003, Early 2004 version of Runescape yes, thats right 194 client cached. I intend on making this a Revamp for all those Runescape players who played during the 2003-2004 legacy. Also if anyone happens to have a fresh version of the 194 cache PLEASE PM me it, read the 'Update Blog' for Updates of course.
[U][B]Update Blog -[/B][/U] [CODE]11/13/2008 - Started working on my own framework, completed rendering, walking, and talking, also waiting for 194 cache accidently deleted it and I cannot retrieve it.[/CODE][/CENTER]
[B][U][CENTER]Credit List -[/CENTER][/U][/B] [CENTER][CODE]JaGex for their deobfusticated 194 Client. Ben for his support. Iyr/Eddie for his support. IntelliJ IDEA for creating the source. Varek I'm using RS2DV for guidance.[/CODE][/CENTER] List will grow I'm sure of it.[/QUOTE] [CENTER][IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/5obgi.gif[/img][/CENTER] [CENTER]Well, after not finding the 194 Cache again I've decided to make this into a 317 Client base inhanced with an 377 cache.
I think, I might've made the right choice about this sudden change. Well anywho onto the updates.[/CENTER]
[CENTER][B][U][I]Updates -[/CENTER] [CENTER][CODE]Finished the server base sticking to the same 317 protocol, and etcetera. Finished Rendering, Talking, Walking, Trading, and the packets. Basic combat with a few flaws so far. 20% Melee Combat complete. 15% Ranged Combat. 75% Magic Combat. Finished off Smelting. Started on finishing Mining, Fletching, and Woodcutting. Trying to figure out how to get running in-game to work.[/CODE][/CENTER]
[CENTER][B][I][U]Pictures/Media -[/U][/I][/B] [CENTER][B][U][I]Mining & Smelting[/I][/U][/B] [url=http://nl.tinypic.com/player.php?v=3127cav&s=4]http://nl.tinypic.com/player.php?v=3127cav&s=4[/url][/CENTER]
[CENTER][B][U][I]Woodcutting & Fletching[/I][/U][/B] [url=http://nl.tinypic.com/player.php?v=a1tq9z&s=4]http://nl.tinypic.com/player.php?v=a1tq9z&s=4[/url][/CENTER]
[CENTER][B][U][I]Basic Combat (Melee & Ranged) [url=http://nl.tinypic.com/player.php?v=20tqcr5&s=4]http://nl.tinypic.com/player.php?v=20tqcr5&s=4[/url][/CENTER]
[CENTER][B][U][I]Ancient Magicks/Normal Magic. [url=http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=2mzbj4h&s=4]http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=2mzbj4h&s=4[/url] [url=http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=15d2alz&s=4]http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=15d2alz&s=4[/url][/CENTER]

Anyway today I’ve just whipped up a quick Personal Message code,(Friends list and Ignore list).

item.title: Simplicity
item.dc:creator: @LtJesus LtJesus
item.description:
@LtJesus wrote:

[QUOTE][CENTER]

[size=10pt]W[/size]elcome to my project thread for my Late 2003, Early 2004 version of Runescape yes, thats right 194 client cached. I intend on making this a Revamp for all those Runescape players who played during the 2003-2004 legacy. Also if anyone happens to have a fresh version of the 194 cache PLEASE PM me it, read the ‘Update Blog’ for Updates of course.

Update Blog -

11/13/2008 - Started working on my own framework, completed rendering, walking, and talking, also waiting for 194 cache accidently deleted it and I cannot retrieve it.

[CENTER]Credit List -[/CENTER]
[CENTER]JaGex for their deobfusticated 194 Client. Ben for his support. Iyr/Eddie for his support. IntelliJ IDEA for creating the source. Varek I'm using RS2DV for guidance.[/CENTER]
List will grow I’m sure of it.[/QUOTE] [CENTER][/CENTER]
[CENTER]Well, after not finding the 194 Cache again I’ve decided to make this into a 317 Client base inhanced with an 377 cache.

I think, I might’ve made the right choice about this sudden change. Well anywho onto the updates.[/CENTER]

[CENTER][B][U][I]Updates -[/CENTER]
[CENTER]Finished the server base sticking to the same 317 protocol, and etcetera. Finished Rendering, Talking, Walking, Trading, and the packets. Basic combat with a few flaws so far. 20% Melee Combat complete. 15% Ranged Combat. 75% Magic Combat. Finished off Smelting. Started on finishing Mining, Fletching, and Woodcutting. Trying to figure out how to get running in-game to work.[/CENTER]

[CENTER]Pictures/Media -
